website_summaries.verdict: The Forerunner 735XT is an exceptional watch for serious triathletes, but there are better and cheaper alternatives for both dedicated runners and more casual athletes.
pros: Lightweight and waterproof, and has GPS for tracking a variety of sports and an optical heart-rate sensor
All-day activity tracking, interval training and phone notifications are helpful
There's a multisport mode to time triathlon transitions and easily switch sport profiles
It's compatible with a wide-range of Garmin accessories
cons: there's no altimeter for measuring ascent and descent
and battery life may not be long enough for a full Ironman triathlon

customer_reviews.title: Great Runner's watch
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why you need a more expensive model. This seems to do everything. I looked at the other garmin watches and settled on this one. Charging tip: Let the watch linger on the charger for a while longer after it registers 100% charged. If you do it will last all week. I get 3 inside runs and 2 outside runs out of it before having to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: How Garmin handled my Garmin failure.
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Garmin consistently for over a year. It is light, functional, waterproof and surprising. I finished a swim and looked at the the computer afterwards, and it recognized my strokes. Here is the wow. My screen died recently for an unknown reason. Garmin replaced it with a refurbished watch, even though it is past warranty. That says a lot about a company. ++++
customer_reviews.author: J Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, feature packed, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Awesome combo. I am training for Tough Murder and a half marathon this year aiming to sign on for my first triathlon next year. This watch makes it easy to keep track of my performance and shows me how to improve with the HRM combo. Originally I was going to get the forerunner235 but the added triathlon feature futureproofed the 735 for me. This is definitely a watch i will grow with!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: the pool strap stays in place while pushing off from the wall on my local pool and the Tri Strap has held up well with extended use and is comfortable even with 4 hour bike rides
customer_reviews.text: Solid watch, have used it daily since I received it for OWS, biking, running, pool swim, a Triathlon and it has performed exactly as expected. The straps are as advertised, the pool strap stays in place while pushing off from the wall on my local pool and the Tri Strap has held up well with extended use and is comfortable even with 4 hour bike rides. If you don't need golf, skiing or 14+ hour battery life I would highly recommend taking a look at the 735XT over the Fenix or 935.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after swimming in a pool a few times
customer_reviews.text: I had this watch for 2 years. It was working generally fine for running although it stopped paring with HRM run monitor strap after one year. Then it died after swimming in a pool a few times. The screen went black and could not be restored. According to other reviews, this is not uncommon. While Garmin sells this for triathlon, this watch should not be used in water. This 735xt is obviously not water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Jogger F

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: My beloved heart monitor of 14 years finally died (well it didn't die the sensor did, and it is so outdated it couldn't be replaced.) So I started the search to replace it. I cannot fully describe how nearly perfect this device is. It is easy to use, tracks every metric you will ever need to, and is comfortable to wear. My only concern with it is that there really isn't a bevel on the face, which may lead to scratches, but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dies during Iron Distances
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch. I love the tri bundle. But I bought this watch to race an Ironman for which I did and finished under 13 hours. The watch battery died before I finished the race. I turned off all features such as heart rate and bluetooth and it still died before the end of the race. My friend warned me before the race to turn off the features because his watch died at 12 hours in an Ironman the previous year. It's a great watch if you plan on racing triathlons up to the Half Iron distance, but research other options if you plan on facing Iron distances.
customer_reviews.author: James Hawley

customer_reviews.title: it stopped working, lasted less than 3 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these product in August 2016. It has been great and I was really happy about the performance of this Triathlon watch, suddenly this week not even 3 years after my purchase, the black round sticker in the back that surrounds the sensor fell off, ande the battery takes too long to charge and does not last more than one day. I would expect that the product lasted longer since it costs around $600
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Casillas

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Garmin!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Haven't used the transition function yet but the rest of the watch has been on point. I wear all day, sleep with it on at night, and can get about 4-5 solid workouts on it before it hits 20%battery left.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Shoenberger

customer_reviews.title: Best Watch For XC runners
customer_reviews.text: I am a high school cross country runner and could not recommend this watch more. It gives you every statistic or number about the way you run you could ever need. In addition to running cross country, I am also training for the Chicago Marathon and this watch has done everything I need it to. Overall, I could not recommend the Forerunner 735 XT more.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Light, Battery for a week, a lots of Tweaks for the screens, Insights are great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with both of the bands. I tried with run and swim and works as expected. The Watch is a really good option for the ones who are willing to be more serious on training, have in mind I used to use an Apple Watch Series 2. Right now I am using the watch like all day monitoring and fits well, collecting my steps, hr beats and calories Si if you are planning to train for a Half or Marathon and in the near future will go to a Triathlon is the one to buy
customer_reviews.author: Ezequiel Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Git this for my husband who's training for triathlons. ...
customer_reviews.text: Git this for my husband who's training for triathlons. He absolutely loves the watch. Its lightweight and he likes that he can set the different disciplines he will do on a day and he doesn't need to do anything to adjust between the changes. He is also very impressed with the swimming function.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen F.

customer_reviews.title: A lot packed into a lightweight watch, but very fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good light weight watch for runners and road cyclists. Works well with garmin connect and pairs easy with the phone. I don’t recommend for mountain biking as it is too fragile. As you can see from the photo, a stray tree branch can easily crack the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for athletes
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate monitor connection is seamless. Works very well. Great for a variety of workouts.
customer_reviews.author: dan_liz82

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so far. Helps to get my training in order and to pace myself better to prep for marathon. The HRM is a must for serious training. Although there are more features than needed, you can customise to your needs and download relevant apps freely available on Garmin store.
customer_reviews.author: jin foong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mi
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of these things. The best for multi sport.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Odreman

customer_reviews.title: Garmin watch
customer_reviews.text: My son researched for this watch for his birthday gift and he loves it. It has all the features he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Junesculpts

customer_reviews.title: ... a year now and can say it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a year now and can say it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: Had this watch for a few months now and find it to be excellent. Have used it for running and swimming without issue. The accuracy of the GOS seems spot on and being able to track a run without using my phone is a nice change. Battery life seems good. Longest run so far is about 10k with GPS mode and still lasts the week with another few 5k’s included. Yet to use the chest strap HRM running but the wrist HRM seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, great battery. Lots of functionality and stats
customer_reviews.text: Great, in size it is not huge as Fenix but it has pretty much same functionalities. I used for running, open water swimming and crossfit. It seems ver accurate. Nice to monitor steps and sleep as well. Very good battery life (reason why i sold my apple watch). I use it every day as normal watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Renato Theodoro

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is most probably the best purchase I have done in a long time! Garmin hit the mark with the 735XT! Love the size - very easy to manage all the functions - with the HRM, great combination ! Full marks !
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Gouws

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing watching! The product is very light and the right screen size (easy to see while biking and running).
customer_reviews.author: Luciano Nunes

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Garmin is in decent condition but died and won’t turn on after 3yrs of having it..
customer_reviews.author: amnerpereira

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in races
customer_reviews.text: Need I say more? Perfect in races, perfect for everyday use. But the 14 hr limit can be a challenge. I doubt it will last that long. I will see if it can come Jan. 29 where there is a 14 hr cut off on the mountain race I am joining.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Tan

customer_reviews.title: great watch! Son loves it for running and all ...
customer_reviews.text: great watch! Son loves it for running and all the stats it provides. speedy delivery
customer_reviews.author: Kim B. Vermette

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my Fitbit. Took some getting used to, but I am in happy with the results
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great sports watch.
customer_reviews.text: Small, light packed with all the features needed to improve your triathlon or chosen sports. The swim heart rate monitor actually stays in place when swimming. Combined with Garmin connect or strava, it's a super training package
customer_reviews.author: George Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: is unnecessary.
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin does more than I need! On the other hand, it does exactly what is necessary for my workouts. The Bluetooth, etc., for me, is unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: chistopher baker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to read , u dont even have to read the instructions like it alot
customer_reviews.author: juan mateos

customer_reviews.title: Good watch poor chest strap.
customer_reviews.text: Chest strap quality needs to improve. Years past and still is the same old quality. Just uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Francesco S. Borace G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful and easy to use. Great accuracy. I love the battery performance.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda C-V

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Watch, have all the functions that I need. Bike, running and Swim
customer_reviews.author: Renato Dutra Simoes

customer_reviews.title: SCUFFED ON DAY ONE
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and easy to use once you learn to navigate it. My only gripe is that this watch is comparable in price to the Apple Watch and although I went in the direction of the Forerunner 735XT as it is a superior choice for athletes, it is made of plastic!!! And mine got scuffed on the first day of wearing it. A watch this expensive shouldn't be made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking watch
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking watch, light on weight and the GARMIN app it's a good companion with great user interface. Good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't figured out to set the intervals but i like it much better than much 610.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Carefull
customer_reviews.text: The watch started to have problems with the buttom control, the screen move up to down in a spin movement. Amazon recommended to conctact the manufacter and Garmin recommended exchange the item but I need to create a ticket calling 1800XXXX. The cost of call is 40$ and the costs of the shipment and delivery should be asume by the client. Be carefull.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: This Forerunner 735 XT is a good watch but definitely not what I paid for it ...
customer_reviews.text: It should have exact elevation on it and the activity of walking on it, especially for how expensive it was. I also bought a Garmin Fenix 3 HR with these and a lot more activities and extras for a lot let than I bought this watch for. This Forerunner 735 XT is a good watch but definitely not what I paid for it considering all it does not have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new running partner
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, accurate heart rate at the wrist, plenty of features, havent made it through them all yet. Only knock is GPS could be more accurate. GLONASS wasnt enabled by default, helps a little bit but iphone gps is still superior.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Good multisport watch
customer_reviews.text: Works really well - needs an option for Duathlons and Quick Release set up for use in multisport events
customer_reviews.author: Jax Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: Right device for the right purpose but not for everybody
customer_reviews.text: If this device were less expensive, I would give it 5 stars. For the cost, I would like to have a brighter screen and a few more native workout options beyond Swim, Bike, Run. That said, this is a great smart watch. I love the 24 x 7 HR monitoring, sleep monitoring, step monitoring, and smartphone connectivity. And, of course, the real reason to get it is the performance intelligence Garmin has built-into this unit. Swim, Bike, Run - tons of metrics, great connectivity to all sorts of apps and online systems. Ergonomics (other than screen brightness) are excellent as well - very light and comfortable. Great device!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I also hate having it tell me to move when I'm already ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were more modes (hike, ski, etc). I also hate having it tell me to move when I'm already walking/moving but not swinging my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, dark screen
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch and a lot of functionality, but the lighting is too light. Dark screen and I didn't like it!
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Cristian Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Unable to find a direct phone support phone number on garmin site.
customer_reviews.text: my watch is unable to auto-correct time/date and the phone # i used 3 days ago is no longer active. i was unable to find a direct call # on garmin site.
customer_reviews.author: Harley D

customer_reviews.title: I downloaded the directions they are terrible, for the price that Garmin charges for this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was given this watch as a present. I read the directions that were enclosed they were written poorly so I called Garmin and was told that the directions could be downloaded. I downloaded the directions they are terrible, for the price that Garmin charges for this watch I think that well written concise operating instructions should not be too much to ask. If you are looking for a watch that is easy to use and intuitive this is not the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend....
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate. Said hr was 35, when taken manually got 52. And, where is my first negative review I submitted Amazon? Yes, the watch looks nice, really nice actually, but for the $, it better function right more!
customer_reviews.author: SixStringSlinger71

customer_reviews.title: Best watch i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my vivo active, that was still working and an awesome watch with this one, wow was i surprised, great watch very reliable, for a triathlete this is the best watch. I do wish it had or a download is available for thing like rower, row machine, elliptical and weight training. I do miss those features from the vivo active, but i also went ahead and purchased the speed / cadence sensor and the foot pod and the data that it shows is unbelievable, run contact time, foot speed, etc. For the price this is a piece of equipment that i count on, on a daily basis. Keeps my training focused and gives me tons of data.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness device / smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pros on buying this watch. The only reason I give it 4 starts is that the usability of the menu is not very good and the screen is not touch. I always have a hard time remembering where are some of the options I want to use, and the navigation with the buttons sometimes is confusing. That said, the precision and the feedback trough the app are great. The running bundle is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: RoBin

customer_reviews.title: Great package deal
customer_reviews.text: This model fits all my needs for getting in aerobic shape and training for marathon. The heart rate monitor strap serves to assist in tracking various benchmarks such as VO2 Max, etc. Great package deal. (Two critical observations - 1) hard to see the illuminated numbers on dial if wearing inside - it seems the illumination shows up much stronger outside, especially in sunlight. 2) there is a bit of learning curve to use all the bells and whistles. Not necessarily intuitive - it takes some reading on the Garmin website.)
customer_reviews.author: Wakiva

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had a forerunner 305 for 10 years. I was waiting for it to die, but its still going strong. I wanted an upgrade so after a bunch of research and watching several youtube reviews i went with the 753xt. I love it. Light and comfortable, long battery life. I charge it once a week but I have gone up to 9 days with several swims, runs and bike rides using GPS. No problems. Gives you all kinds of data. This thing motivates me to go faster and farther. Get one, you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Mont

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've been running with various GPS watches for about 10 years. The evolution of the products has been very nice to see. Better fit, more "watch" like form, and additional features keep coming. I moved from the 230 to the 735XT to add wrist based heart rate monitor and the additional running related data. Zero problems so far!
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps track of the essentials
customer_reviews.text: This has been essential for my running to see not only my heart rate training but pace and distance. I don't find all the supposed wonderful apps and watch faces you can download and add to be that helpful as I can't get that to work.
customer_reviews.author: Samatha Smith

customer_reviews.title: Received item in good time. Had issues to sync but resolved it ...
customer_reviews.text: Received item in good time. Had issues to sync but resolved it with support team and it works great and very light for all it has. Customization to a variety of trainings is easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert7N

customer_reviews.title: Great sport watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Lots of features, easy to use, doesn't lose connectivity, pairs with phones / computers easily. I'm a newbie to running and this has helped me tremendously to dial in my form and distance. Data-lovers dream.
customer_reviews.author: S. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: A much better Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Very fast (compared to earlier Garmin products), great display. A big, big upgrade for my Fenix 2.
customer_reviews.author: René A. Lankenau

customer_reviews.title: ... a few days but until now everything has been perfect, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've just worn it for a few days but until now everything has been perfect, very comfortable, light and looks great. I'm a bit worried about the hr monitor accuracy, it fluctuates so much, but it might me that I'm just finding the best way to adjust the watch to my arm.
customer_reviews.author: alomariox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, does everything it says and does it ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, does everything it says and does it quite well. I also found it pretty easy to use. Package arrive on time and everything was in mint condition. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Lee Flores

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Is my first Garmin. Very complete and functional. I am still learning how to use all the functions. The HRM Run is fundamental to improve your trainning. Didn't pair with my android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: you can colect good informations!
customer_reviews.text: Very precision and work very well... you can colect good informations!
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: Just Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just Love it!!!!! Best watch ever!!!! Great that it has a heart rate monitor on the wrist which makes running so much easier!!!!! 100% recommend it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for the wrist sensor, overly complicated
customer_reviews.text: Has tons of features, but is a very overly complicated to use. I find the wrist heart rate sensor useless and inaccurate. Turns on when not being worn and records junk data, and does not accurately read wrist HR during my yoga practices. Extremely difficult to program and the desktop/web interface and app are less than useless. I like the chest strap better than the Polar H7 I used to have. This one has a hook that inserts into a loop, which is much more secure than others.
customer_reviews.author: K. P.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite sport watch ever
customer_reviews.text: My favorite sport watch ever! i consider it to be my running partner. It helps me to stay motivated and continue running.
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: The best garmin ever and my third model
customer_reviews.text: The best garmin ever and my third model. lighter than the 920xt and with the more functions. just a little smaller for a multisport watch, but still great.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lucia Araujo de Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my daughter. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice bit of kit. A light everyday watch which can also meet all you training needs
customer_reviews.author: Walkabout

customer_reviews.title: and it only took a year to come back to Garmin and man am I glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Went from a Garmin Forerunner 220, to an Apple Watch, and it only took a year to come back to Garmin and man am I glad I did!!!!! This watch has the same features as the apple watch except the battery lasts a week before needing to recharge, with use 5 to 6 times a week for running and daily for texts, and is GPS independent and water proof, what's not to love!!!! I'm an apple guy at heart, but this is the way to go for sure!!!! Glad I got it!!
customer_reviews.author: sjtcnote1

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a watch
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this watch it's actually a watch. The 920 is too huge! Easy to use and no problems battery life seems great
customer_reviews.author: John K. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: but love it so
customer_reviews.text: Still figuring out all the features, but love it so far
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Perry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works, which is more than I can say for the 900XT it replaces...
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Shea

product_meta.title: Garmin Forerunner 735XT Bundle, Multisport GPS Running Watch with Heart Rate, Includes HRM-Run Monitor, Midnight/Frost Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Midnight/Frost Blue| Style:Run-Bundle| Pattern Name:GPS Running WatchBe a better athlete today than you were yesterday with forerunner 735XT. This GPS multisport Watch is for athletes who want dialed-in data for training and a lighter load on race day. Wrist-based Heart rate lets you run freer when it's time to toe the line. For advanced running dynamics and other detailed measurements, add a chest strap and train your Heart out. Includes Starve suffer score, activity profiles for running, cycling, swimming and more. The auto multisport feature lets you transition sports with just one button press. Smart notifications, automatic uploads and connect IQ compatibility for custom Watch faces and apps make the 735XT the ultimate smart watch for athletes.
feature_bullets: Run Bundle - comes with the HRM-Run monitor to measure cadence, vertical oscillation and ground contact time
Built-in activities - data support for: running, cycling, swimming, multisport, hiking, xc skiing, strength, paddle sports and cardio
Offers VO2 max estimate, lactate threshold (when used with a chest strap heart rate monitor), race predictor and recovery advisor
Connected features4: smart notifications, automatic uploads to Garmin Connect, live tracking and more
Customize with free watch faces, apps and more from our Connect IQ store

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,263 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
